TopicTitle: The Origins of the Kerbin Terrain.

Articles.Content:
Hey guys! After scouting around for maps that I could use for my sci-fi story, I came across a map that was awkwardly similar to Kerbin. It has a few differences but I believe this was the original map used by Squad to make Kerbin (they did tweak it though). The name of the planet is Cytheria

Source: http://http://www.obsidianportal.com/campaign/the-cytherian-annexation/wikis/cytheria-planetary-survey

Edited July 8, 2013 by Tuna7
Source Update. Thanks Boffinbox
are you sure all that link is to is the same photo
Not sure if this is legit, or if I've just been trolled...
I can assure you that this is real. Me no troll.
think this is a troll with a pre-0.14 map
I too, have seen this map before. Now I wonder, may other planets also be copied?

no i'm pretty sure that's just old kerbin flipped

http://www.majhost.com/gallery/borna123456/GTPlanet/kerbin_colour.png

EDIT: better source. you make the call

http://www.obsidianportal.com/campaign/the-cytherian-annexation/wikis/cytheria-planetary-survey

EDIT2: i've kept digging and found this from 2010

http://s4.zetaboards.com/AlphaCentari/topic/8033642/1/

EDIT3: which in turn led me to this. page copyright 2003-2005

http://libnoise.sourceforge.net/examples/complexplanet/

EDIT4: wouldn't mind some of this terrain on kerbin, that's for sure

(sorry about all the edits, i'm just so hyped by finding this stuff)

Edited July 8, 2013 by Boffinbox
Thanks a lot!

honestly confirmed for no troll. there was me thinking you were trying to link us to questionable content, but Tuna was right!

EDIT: had a look into that celestia screenshot; celestia 1.3.1 was released back in '04. kerbin is 9 years old!

More screenies of Reallife Kerbin are needed!

Copies are really easy to find, just drag the map image to google image search and you'll get dozens of hits.

There are 2 options:

1 - It is a royalty free image, SQUAD mirrored it and called it Kerbin.

2 - SQUAD created it and others are using it with or without permissions. If the latter is true SQUAD really has it's work cut out.

1 - It is a royalty free image, SQUAD mirrored it and called it Kerbin.

it's definitely the first option.

It's an open source noise map. Squad mirrored it and called it Kerbin, and have since then tweaked it.
